creator: k.huwig.apache@huwig.de
text:
The mx4j-jmx.jar used in 5.0.28 has a race condition:

https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail&atid=450647&aid=1068766&group_id=47745
https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail&atid=450647&aid=859550&group_id=47745

This crashed our Tomcat several times. The suggested fix from the MX4J-project
is to use the current version of the library.

You can swap the updated MX4J library in for existing Tomcat installations.  I 
will modify builds for 5.1.31 and beyond to use the updated MX4J library.  And 
I'm changing the component for this issue from 5.5.0 to 5.0.28.

(Tomcat 5.x doesn't use MX4J).
creator: yoavs@computer.org

text:
Sorry for using the wrong version; I was quite busy today. I just wanted the
Tomcat project to know about this MX4J problem. Thanks for confirming the switch
to the newer version.
creator: k.huwig.apache@huwig.de
yoavs@computer.org
text:
Tomcat 5.0 build file updated to use MX4J 2.1, build tested, seems fine.  
Future (5.0.31 and later) releases of Tomcat will ship with this updated MX4J 
version.  Change log also updated to refer to this Bugzilla issue.  Thanks for 
bringing it to our attention.
